Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2011 01:33AM Jalsmama55 wrote: I'm so sorry you're going through this. I had a similar situation. Originally had lumpectomy and got path back saying cancer. Then had MRI bilaterally. That showed more nonsense in the cancer side and questionable lymphnodes. I immediately opted for BMX because I didn't want to mess around. I have 3 young children. Although I was scared to death and it seemed like each new phone call from a dr was worse than the last, I made it through. I also have to say that the BMX wasn't as awful as I had imagined and quite honestly, I was happy to get those things off with all the problems they were apparently causing me. I always thought of it as "these b$tches aren't worth my life" so I really didn't regret it for even a second. I still haven't had recon due to the fact that recon would've put off chemo even longer. So I'll start that process sometime between October and december (haven't decided yet). Please let us know how you're doing. Lots of love and hugs Xoxoxo
Posts.Title: Can I just vent, please? BlueCowgirl GirlFriday

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2016 11:31PM Jalsmama55 wrote: Hello Hopfull2, sorry you have to be here but so glad you found us. I was also 37 with 3 young children when I was diagnosed. It's very scary and overwhelming. Saying lots of prayers that you're still stage 0. The fear is what gets the best of all of us in the beginning. As soon as you have your path report and have a plan in place, you'll start to feel a little more in control. Take care and keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed Hopfull2 Jalsmama55

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2010 11:39PM Jalsmama55 wrote: Margie, So sorry to hear what you're going through. I know its easier said than done, but like I've been doing, try to stay positive and only deal with what you know to be true.. I've decided that if my pathology results come back as cancer tomorrow, theres nothing that i can do to change it regardless, so why freak myself out until I actually know whats going on.. Am i still scared? Absolutely! I'm totally worried for my children etc, but i won't be much use to them if I'm a total wreck and regardless, I dont want to live my life like that.. B9 wishes and best of luck to you darling.. <3  Thanks everyone for the kind words.. I'll post an update after my follow up with surgeon tomorrow..For now, I'm still a little sore but mostly just itching like crazy from the bandages, tape and healing process Ugh!  And totally forgot to start stool softeners before taking my painkillers, so I'm sure you can all imagine what that means about now (2 days in) YUK! :)  Thanks again all for the positive thoughts and prayers! xoxo
Posts.Title: BIRADS 4 and terrified!! Jalsmama55 zlota

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2010 04:11PM Jalsmama55 wrote: Hello all, heres the update regardidng my surgery yesterday.. Had lumpectomy X3. Dr said the smaller of the 3 lumps are "nothing" and had pathologist take an initial look and they concur on that. After laying eyes on the big one, hes still very concerned. We all got the feeling that hes pretty sure it cancer but hes still being optimistic. he said he might have taken too much of a margin on the inside skin side because the top of the tumor was so close to the surface, but he wanted to make sure he got everything. therefore i have quite a dent.. But like i told him,"They might be attached to me but im not attached to them so do what u gotta do" lol, he smiled :).I see surgeon monday and get pathology results..   I really want to thank everyone here for the positive thoughts, prayers, good juju etc.. It means oh so much.. i am very positive right now and feel that no matter what, ill make it through this. With the love of my family and u amazing people here, i can do anything..  Love and B9 wishes to all of you! XOXOXO
Posts.Title: BIRADS 4 and terrified!! Jalsmama55 zlota

Posts.Content: Jalsmama55 wrote: Hello everyone. im so extremely scared right now and just looking for some support and opinions. Last monday i found a lump, that evening i saw my gp.. she immediately referred me for stat mammo, US and general surgeon consult. Mammo and US came back BIRADS 4 (suspicious for malignancy). Also, in addition to the initial lump i felt which is 2.5 cm, they found 2 more that are 0.7 and 0.8 cm.. The big ine showed mild central acoustical shadowing, areas of spiculation and is hypoechoic. The 0.7cm one is hypoechoic, has angulated margins and no evidence of acoustical shadowing. The 0.8cm lesion is also hypoechoic, but with distinct margins and no acoustical shadowing (the most promising of the 3)..  i have 3 small sons ages 3.6.and 9 and I'm terrified beyond belief as im sure most of you can understand..saw surgeon Monday and im scheduled for  guide wire placement for the smaller tumors then lumpectomy X 3 this friday. i had the option of course of core needle biopsy, but i chose to save myself a procedure since he was going to do lumpectomy regardless. if pathology comes back positive for bc, ill then have sentinel node biopsy and he will open me back up to widen the margins of positive area and retrieve nodes if necessary..   Anyone else had the majority of these variables and characteristics and pathology came back B9? With the research ive done, the spiculation alone flips the odds from 80% chance of B9 to 20% chance of B9.  That sound about right? im so sorry for rambling but i just had to get it all out and wanted to give as much info possible for replies purposes. Thanks so much in advance for any support and replies!!!  PLEOMORPHIC MULTIFOCAL, MULTICENTRIC ILC.  BMX 9/14/10, ALND to right. Chemo (TC) x4, 38 Rads, tamoxifen and zoladex Surgery 7/30/2010 Lumpectomy: Right Dx 8/4/2010, LCIS/ILC/IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 2/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 9/14/2010 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right Chemotherapy 10/20/2010 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 2/15/2011 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 2/21/2011 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Surgery 11/15/2013 Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Surgery 3/27/2014 Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement Surgery 10/16/2014 Reconstruction (left) Surgery 2/19/2015 Prophylactic ovary removal Hormonal Therapy Femara (letrozole) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: BIRADS 4 and terrified!! Jalsmama55 zlota

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2010 02:14AM Jalsmama55 wrote: Thanks so much for the reminder of positive thinking.. just so hard at this point, especially with small children to consider..I'm also in the medical field so i freak myself out even more because of everything i see,, UGH!! Like you said, I have to stay positive and see what happens.. <3

Posts.Title: Biopsy tomorrow...can pleomorphic be benign? mamatoboyz wonderfullymade

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2010 02:39AM Jalsmama55 wrote: Hello everyone! This is my first post here in the stage II forum, but not my first on bc.org.... So thankful to have a place to come to where everyone knows pretty much exactly what I'm going through . I'm having a BMX on 9/14, then following with chemo after that. I am holding off on reconstruction until after all treatment is complete because doing it now would delay starting chemo much too long for my liking due to healing time for recon. I think about everyone on here daily and pray for strength and quick healing for all!  Much love and support! XOXOXO
Posts.Title: Stage II Forum rumoret NativeMainer

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2015 09:37PM Jalsmama55 wrote: Hello, I was diagnosed with lymphedema after my BMX and ALND on the right only. My experience was that initially after my unilateral DIEP, my lymphedema got better. And it was especially good while I still had JP drains in. I did however also notice that once I had the TE placed on my non cancer side, the lymphedema got a little bit worse. I assume from the TE and then subsequent placement of the implant causing more pressure and therefore blocking lymph channels. This is just my personal experience. Although it is a little bit worse, I would still do recon all over again. My lymphedema is mild truncal on cancer side and in my entire cancer side arm including hand and fingers. Hope this helps
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after developing lymphedema? chipmunk57 chipmunk57
